phys Namespace Reference

The bulk of the engine components go in this namspace. More...

Namespaces

namespace  crossplatform
 

All functionality that needs different implemenations per platform will go in here.


namespace  debug
 

This namespace is for internal debugging tools. In general it should be used in game code.


namespace  internal
 

This namespace is used for internal helper classes, and in general it should be ignored by game developers.

 This is an internal datatype use to communicate with the User input Subsystem.

Detailed Description

The bulk of the engine components go in this namspace.

This is where imporant classes like World, CallBackManager, and The eventmanager reside. For more detailed usage information please refer to individual class documentation or the Physgame main page.

Typedef Documentation

phys::RawEvent

This is an internal datatype use to communicate with the User input Subsystem.

For internal use only.

This is a typedef to SDL_Event. See the SDL Documentation for more details

Definition at line 74 of file datatypes.h.

phys::Real

A Datatype used to represent a real floating point number.

This Datatype is currently a typedef to a float, This is to match our compilations of Ogre (rendering subsystem ogre::Real), and Bullet (physics subsystem, btScalar). With a recompilation of all the subsystems and this there is no reason theoretical reason why this could not be changed to a double, or even something more extreme like a GMP datatype

Definition at line 58 of file datatypes.h.

phys::String

A Datatype used to a series of characters.

This is a typedef to std::string.

Definition at line 68 of file datatypes.h.

phys::Whole

A Datatype used to represent an postive integer numbers.

This is a typedef to unsigned long.
